page.title: 01The Malpas Area of Newport
page.content: Bettws and Malpas are on{the north {side of Newport}town centre and have developed as the town has grown. The oldest{houses}are in the{industrial {area}near the town centre and the River Usk,on flat land called{Crindau. The{countryside}is{undulating generally except for{two hills}in the older,residential part in the south- east.These vantage points show how housing estates have encroached upon the{agricultural land.}About a third of the whole area is grazing land or woodland and now the {M4 motorway } runs from east to west in the south, crossing the River Usk and passing under Brynglas Hill by means of a{ {tunnel.}For some distance the motorway runs parallel to the disused canal.
